title: Generative Sketching
description: These are a series of experiments in generative sketching using BZ-Reactions, Braitenberg Vehicles and Boids. The systems are built using simple rules, from which emerge more complex behaviors. They were developed from scratch in C++ (OpenFrameworks). System details are included below each video.

captions.155929761: BZ (Belousovâ€“Zhabotinsky) Reactions are chemical reactions involving multiple oscillating seeds. Here, I applied the same principles to a spherical mesh, offsetting along the gradient of flow to better understand the directionality of movement.
captions.144834687: Reactive agents, similar to Valentino Braitenberg's vehicles or Seymour Papert's turtles, are drawn toward and away from areas, creating habitable valleys and desolate mountains.
captions.144834685: More reactive agents, with different parameters.
